DOC.brief_summary: Fifty consecutive patients with symptoms suggestive of peptic ulcer disease were included. All underwent complete clinical evaluation, laboratory investigations, upper gastrointestinal endoscopy and rapid urease test. Measurement of serum zinc level was done for all the included patients in addition to twenty five age and sex matched healthy control subjects.
DOC.brief_title: Serum Zinc, Peptic Ulcer Disease and H. Pylori Infection
DOC.criteria: Symptoms suggestive of peptic ulcer disease like epigastric pain, dyspepsia, heartburn Patients who received zinc supplementation, proton pump inhibitors (PPI), nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) Those presented with hematemesis or melena Those with chronic liver disease, renal failure, malabsorption or previous gastric surgery
